summary: This is an email chain from August 14, 2019, discussing staff on AWOL (Absent Without Leave) status and inquiring about overtime assignment procedures. It appears to be internal administrative communication, likely from a government or correctional agency, and does not directly reference Epstein, his associates, victims, or case events.
keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 14, 2019, regarding staff administrative status.
It lists 11 staff members reported as AWOL for the week of August 4-10, 2019, but all names are redacted.
Reasons for absence include OWCP (Office of Workers' Compensation Programs) cases ending, surgery, expired military orders, and a probationary officer injury.
The email inquires about procedures for assigning voluntary and mandatory overtime, referencing Article 18(p) of a Master Agreement.
The document is administrative in nature and contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his criminal activities, or related individuals.
